lines.content: This is a simple tasks record bot named after my friend Aik Hsu. It is able to provide simple *create-read-update-delete* functionality through a GUI interface. The usage instructions are as follows:
Aikhsu provides support for 3 types of tasks using the specified command format as shown below:
Tasks are automatically saved to an `Aikhsu.txt` file in the same directory as the `jar` file.
- `mark [number]` : marks the specified task as done
- `unmark [number]` : marks the specified task as not done
- `find [task]` : searches for all tasks that matches the provided string task name
- `findbydate [DD/MM/YYYY]` : lists all tasks on the given date

This is a simple tasks record bot named after my friend Aik Hsu. It is able to provide simple *create-read-update-delete* functionality through a GUI interface. The usage instructions are as follows:
Aikhsu provides support for 3 types of tasks using the specified command format as shown below:
Tasks are automatically saved to an `Aikhsu.txt` file in the same directory as the `jar` file.
- `mark [number]` : marks the specified task as done
- `unmark [number]` : marks the specified task as not done
- `find [task]` : searches for all tasks that matches the provided string task name
- `findbydate [DD/MM/YYYY]` : lists all tasks on the given date
* The main application class for Aikhsu, a task management system.
* Manages the user interface, task list, and file operations.
* Constructs an Aikhsu instance with the specified file path for task storage.
* Initializes the task list by loading tasks from the file and sets up the user interface.
* @param filepath The path to the file where tasks are stored.
* The entry point of the Aikhsu application.
* Creates an instance of Aikhsu with a default file name and starts the application.
* Processes a user input string as a command and returns the result for visual UI interaction.
* @param input The raw input string from the user.
* @return The result of the executed command, including output to display.
* Runs the main application loop, displaying the UI and processing user commands until an exit command is received.
* Represents a dialog box consisting of an ImageView to represent the speaker's face
* and a label containing text from the speaker.
* Flips the dialog box such that the ImageView is on the left and text on the right.
public static DialogBox getUserDialog(String text, Image img) {
public static DialogBox getDukeDialog(String text, Image img) {
* A launcher class to workaround classpath issues.
* A GUI for AikHsu using FXML.

* the dialog container. Clears the user input after processing.
* Represents a command to add a new task (Todo, Deadline, or Event) to the task list.
* Extends the Command class to provide task addition functionality based on the command type.

private static final String DEADLINE_FORMAT_MESSAGE = "Deadline task format: deadline <task name> "
private static final String EVENT_FORMAT_MESSAGE = "Event task format: event <task name> "
private static final String INVALID_COMMAND_MESSAGE = "Command not recognised!";
* Constructs an AddCommand with the specified command type and full command string.
* The command string is trimmed to remove leading and trailing whitespace.
* @param commandType  The type of task to add ("todo", "deadline", or "event").
* @param commandString The full input string containing the command and task details.
* Executes the add command by creating and adding a new task to the task list.
* Supports adding Todo, Deadline, or Event tasks based on the command type, parsing
* the command string as needed. Returns an error message if the format is invalid or parsing fails.
* @return A CommandResult containing the result message of the task addition or an error message.
* @throws AikhsuException If date/time parsing fails or task creation encounters an error.
Deadline tmpDeadline = new Deadline(deadlineSegments[0], deadlineDateTime, deadlineSegments[1]);
* Represents an abstract command that can be executed within the application.
* Commands typically manipulate the task list and return a result upon execution.
/** The list of tasks that the command will operate on. */
* Executes the command and returns the result of the execution.
* @return A {@code CommandResult} representing the outcome of the command execution.
* Sets the task list for the command to operate on.
* @param tasks The {@code TaskList} instance to be used by the command.
* Parses user input strings into corresponding Command objects for execution in the Aikhsu application.
* Supports a variety of task management commands such as listing, marking, deleting, and adding tasks.
* Parses a command string into an appropriate Command object based on the first word.
* "findbydate", "deadline", "todo", and "event". Returns a DefaultCommand for unrecognized
* @param commandString The raw input string from the user, containing the command and optional arguments.
* @return A Command object corresponding to the parsed command, or a DefaultCommand if parsing fails.
return new DefaultCommand("Please indicate the task number to mark!");
return new DefaultCommand("Please indicate the task number to unmark!");
return new DefaultCommand("Please indicate the task number to delete!");
return new DefaultCommand("Please type the task you want to find!");
return new DefaultCommand("Please indicate the date with the format DD/MM/YYYY");
* Represents the result of executing a command.
* Constructs a CommandResult with the given output.
* @param commandOutput The output of the executed command.
* Returns the output of the executed command.
* @return The command output as a String.
* Represents a fallback command used when no specific command is recognized or input is invalid.
* Extends the Command class to provide a simple response with a predefined message.
* Constructs a DefaultCommand with the specified message.
* The message is used to inform the user of an issue or unrecognized command.
* @param commandMessage The message to display when the command is executed.
* @throws AssertionError If the commandMessage is null or empty after trimming.
assert commandMessage != null && !commandMessage.trim().isEmpty() : "Command cannot be null or empty!";
* Executes the default command by returning the predefined message.
* @return A CommandResult containing the command message.
* Represents a command to delete a task from the task list based on its index.
* Extends the Command class to provide specific deletion functionality.
private static final String INVALID_INDEX_MESSAGE = "Please provide a number!";
private static final String TASK_NOT_EXISTS_MESSAGE = "Task does not exist!";
* Constructs a DeleteCommand with the specified index string.
* The index string is trimmed to remove leading and trailing whitespace.
* @param indexString The string representing the 1-based index of the task to delete.
* @throws AssertionError If the indexString is null or empty after trimming.
assert indexString != null && !indexString.trim().isEmpty() : "Command cannot be null or empty!";
* Executes the delete command by removing the task at the specified index from the task list.
* Converts the index string to an integer (adjusting from 1-based to 0-based) and attempts deletion.
* @return A CommandResult containing the result message of the deletion operation.
* @throws NumberFormatException If the index string cannot be parsed into an integer.
* @throws AikhsuException If the task index is out of bounds or invalid.
* Represents a command to exit the Aikhsu application.
* Extends the Command class to provide application termination functionality.
* Executes the exit command by printing an exit message and returning a result to terminate the application.
* @return An ExitCommandResult containing a farewell message to signal the applications closure.
* Represents a command result that indicates the program should exit.
* Constructs an ExitCommandResult with the given output message.
* @param s The output message associated with the exit command.
* Terminates the program by calling {@code System.exit(0)}.
* Represents a command to search for tasks in the task list that match a given keyword or phrase.
* Extends the Command class to provide task-finding functionality.
* Constructs a FindCommand with the specified search keyword or phrase.
* @param finder The string to search for in task descriptions.
* Executes the find command by searching the task list for tasks containing the specified keyword.
* @return A CommandResult containing a formatted string of matching tasks.
* Represents a command to find tasks that match a given date.
* Constructs a FindDateCommand with the specified date string.
* @param dateString The date string used to find tasks.
* Executes the find date command, searching for tasks that match the specified date.
* @return A {@code CommandResult} containing the matching tasks or an error message.
* Represents a command to list all tasks in the task list.
* Extends the Command class to provide task-listing functionality.
* Executes the list command by retrieving and returning a string representation of all tasks.
* @return A CommandResult containing a formatted string of all tasks in the task list.
* Represents a command to mark a task as completed.
private static final String INVALID_INDEX_MESSAGE = "Please provide a number!";
private static final String TASK_NOT_EXISTS_MESSAGE = "Task does not exist!";
* Constructs a MarkCommand with the given task index as a string.

* @throws AssertionError if the indexString is null or empty.
assert indexString != null && !indexString.trim().isEmpty() : "Command cannot be null or empty!";

assert indexString != null && !indexString.trim().isEmpty() : "Command cannot be null or empty!";

* @throws NumberFormatException If the index string cannot be parsed into an integer.
* @throws AikhsuException If the task index is out of bounds or invalid.
* Provides utility methods and constants for common operations, such as printing divider lines.
/** A constant string representing a horizontal divider line followed by a newline. */
* Prints a horizontal divider line to the console, followed by a newline.
* A custom exception class for the Aikhsu application, used to handle application-specific errors.
* Extends the standard Exception class to provide tailored error messaging.
* Constructs an AikhsuException with the specified error message.
* @param message The error message describing the exception.
* Constructs an AikhsuException with the specified error message and cause.
* @param message     The error message describing the exception.
* @param description The underlying cause of the exception (a Throwable object).
* Utility class for parsing date and time strings into Java time objects.
* Provides methods to convert formatted date/time strings into {@code LocalDateTime},
* Parses a date-time string into a {@code LocalDateTime} object.
* @param dateTime The date-time string to be parsed, expected in the format {@code dd/MM/yyyy HH:mm}.
* @return A {@code LocalDateTime} object representing the parsed date and time.
* @throws AikhsuException If the input format is invalid.
public static LocalDateTime parseDateTime(String dateTime) throws AikhsuException {
throw new AikhsuException("Invalid date and time format! "
+ "Format must be in the form dd/mm/yyyy xx:xx eg 01/01/2025 16:59");
* Parses a date string into a {@code LocalDate} object.
* @param date The date string to be parsed, expected in the format {@code dd/MM/yyyy}.
* @return A {@code LocalDate} object representing the parsed date.
* @throws AikhsuException If the input format is invalid.
public static LocalDate parseDate(String date) throws AikhsuException {
assert date != null && !date.trim().isEmpty() : "Date cannot be null or empty!";
throw new AikhsuException("Invalid date format! Format must be of the form dd/mm/yyyy");
* Parses a time string into a {@code LocalTime} object.
* @param time The time string to be parsed, expected in the format {@code HH:mm}.
* @return A {@code LocalTime} object representing the parsed time.
* @throws AikhsuException If the input format is invalid.
public static LocalTime parseTime(String time) throws AikhsuException {
assert time != null && !time.trim().isEmpty() : "Date cannot be null or empty!";
throw new AikhsuException("Invalid time format! Format must be of the form xx:xx");

* Represents a deadline task that must be completed by a specific date and time.

* Represents an abstract task with a description and completion status.

return (isDone ? "X" : " "); // mark done task with X
